title: How to Make a Cinnamon Pretzel

steps.headline: Separate the dough into 14 sections.
steps.description: Lightly sprinkle flour on a large board or counter top.

steps.headline: Roll each section of the dough in a 14-16 inch (35-40cm) rope.
steps.description: Form the rope into the shape of a pretzel.

steps.headline: Put the pretzels in the refrigerator until you are ready to boil them.
Add 4 quarts/3.8 liters (1.0 US gal) of water to a large pot and bring to a boil.
steps.description: Lower the heat and add the pretzels, three at a time.

steps.headline: Cook about 2 minutes until you see them rise to the surface.
steps.description: Carefully remove them and place on some paper towels to drain.

steps.headline: Place each boiled pretzel on a buttered sheet pan, separating them about 3 inches/7.5cm apart.
Brush each pretzel with a beaten egg.
steps.description: Sprinkle on the cinnamon or brush on the cinnamon glaze. To make the glaze, use a small bowl and add the  topping ingredients, combining it  with 1-2 Tbs water.

steps.headline: Bake about 15-20 minutes until the pretzels are brown.
Remove from the oven.
steps.description: They're now ready for serving while still deliciously warm.

text: Making the Pretzels Separate the dough into 14 sections. Lightly sprinkle flour on a large board or counter top. Roll each section of the dough in a 14-16 inch (35-40cm) rope. Form the rope into the shape of a pretzel. Put the pretzels in the refrigerator until you are ready to boil them.  Boiling and Glazing the Pretzels Preheat the oven to 400ºF/200ºC.  Add 4 quarts/3.8 liters (1.0 US gal) of water to a large pot and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and add the pretzels, three at a time. Cook about 2 minutes until you see them rise to the surface. Carefully remove them and place on some paper towels to drain. Place each boiled pretzel on a buttered sheet pan, separating them about 3 inches/7.5cm apart.  Brush each pretzel with a beaten egg. Sprinkle on the cinnamon or brush on the cinnamon glaze. To make the glaze, use a small bowl and add the  topping ingredients, combining it  with 1-2 Tbs water. Baking the Pretzels Bake about 15-20 minutes until the pretzels are brown.  Remove from the oven. They're now ready for serving while still deliciously warm.
